definition: erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
elder brother
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]

sentences.english: Buddy, here I've got a cool game to show ya, it's called "Gangstas".
sentences.chinese: 哥們兒，我發現一款超好玩的遊戲，叫“古惑仔”。

sentences.english: I don't want to dice with death by pissing off this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想招惹這哥們兒，自尋死路。

sentences.english: Hi, Monica, this is my number one buddy Ken.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，莫尼卡，這是我最好的哥們兒肯。

sentences.english: He's just a thoroughly good fella, it's as simple as that.
sentences.chinese: 他是個至真至誠的好哥們兒，就這麼簡單。

sentences.english: My mate Cally is up there with the best wingers I've ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 我的哥們兒卡利是我曾見過的最棒的邊路球員。

sentences.english: Drew: Hey, what's up buddy? Did you see the Liverpool game on TV last night?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，怎麼樣，哥們兒，昨晚看利物浦隊的比賽了嗎？

sentences.english: But, if you’re a developer, oh boy, would I be unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你是個開發者，誒，哥們兒，我真替你難過。

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你愛上了自己鐵哥們兒的前女友，而她也愛着你。

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex, and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你愛上了你鐵哥們兒的前女友，而她也愛着你。

definition: Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to have nothing to say (idiom)
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
fellow sufferers empathize with each other (idiom); misery loves company
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to lose face/humiliation
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to play/to have fun/to hang out
there
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
unpleasant talk/malicious words
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to have no sense of shame
wretched (esp. appearance)/vulgar
